value.name: Charleston County OKs $10 million jail death settlement
value.description: A South Carolina county has agreed to pay $10 million to the family of a man with mental health issues whom deputies forced to the ground on his stomach and repeatedly shot with stun guns and pepper spray before he died in jail this January.

video.name: Charleston County OKs $10 million jail death settlement

value.name: Cop Who Shot Walter Scott in the Back Tried to Get Released From Prison This Week — And Was Denied
value.description: The judge denied a motion in which former North Charleston police Officer Michael Slager asked that his 20-year prison sentence for violating Walter Scott’s civil rights be set aside.

value.name: SC ACLU releases “Mobile Justice” app that records police encounters
value.description: The American Civil Liberties Union of South Carolina has launched a free app that allows people to record encounters with law enforcement.

value.name: What’s happening with the federal case against the cops involved in the death of George Floyd
value.description: The announcement of federal charges against Derek Chauvin, J. Alexander Kueng, Thomas Lane and Tou Thao caused a postponement of the state’s case against the latter three. Meanwhile, here’s what to expect in the federal case.

value.name: Commentary: Let's seek forward-looking justice for Jamal Sutherland
value.description: People in Charleston are demanding justice for the death of Jamal Sutherland. They are right. Tragically, in-custody deaths are far too common, and rarely does our system provide real accountability.

value.name: Charleston County will pay $10M to Jamal Sutherland’s family over his SC jail death
value.description: Charleston County Council approved the settlement in a unanimous vote Tuesday evening, exactly 140 days after Jamal Sutherland died at the Al Cannon Detention Center.

value.name: $10M Sutherland payout is ‘largest civil rights settlement in SC’
value.description: At that time, the $6.5 million Walter Scott settlement was the largest such payout. Of the $10 million, Charleston County will pay $8 million. The Charleston County Sheriff’s Office and the North Charleston Police Department will each pay $1 million.

value.name: Officer in Walter Scott shooting sentenced to 20 years
value.description: A white former police officer was sentenced in South Carolina ... pleaded guilty to violating the civil rights of 50-year-old Walter Scott. A state murder trial ended in a hung jury.

value.name: The quiet struggle of Feidin Santana, the man who filmed the shooting of Walter Scott
value.description: Reporters ask him what ran through his mind when a North Charleston police officer raised his .45-caliber Glock 21 handgun and fired it eight times at the back of a fleeing Walter Scott.

value.name: Tragedy of 195 black people killed by police in US since George Floyd's murder
value.description: Walter Scott and Michael Brown. Heartbreaking figures reveal that across the US last year, 1,127 people were killed by police, with a disproportionate number of them from the black community.
